Thers's been a lot of discussion about dbc in theory but is anyone using it
anger?

Meyer writes a very convincing case for dbc, and in partnership with junit
it could be a very powerful tool for building robust systems.

But java doesn't have built in support for dbc (though admittedly we did
get assertions in jdk1.4) and the tool that is often cited, iContract,
seems to have stagnated - at least the site doesn't seem to have been
updated since 2002-04-09.

I posted a similar question to this several months ago and the concensus
seemed to be that where dbc was being used it was at the documentation
level. Is this still the case?

Steven
subject: junit and dbc
